ID: CIQH30S_00
From: Faraz Hasan <Faraz.hasan@chalhoub.com>
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
CC: David Smith <David.Smith@chalhoub.com>; Regi Punnoli; Asfand Khan <Asfand.Khan@chalhoub.com>; Fernalyn Tosloc <Fernalyn.Tosloc@chalhoub.com>; Zain Manna <Zain.Manna@chalhoub.com>; Jacek Roszkowiak <jacek.roszkowiak@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-05-30 17:09
Subject: Infosys Renewal - Insurance Provision
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Hagop,

Hope all is well.

We are renewing the Managed Services Agreement with Infosys and they have suggested an amendment regarding the insurance policies referenced in the MSA. The clause they have added is:

All references to insurance policies in the MSA “insurance for a minimum of” or any similar expression, shall be deemed amended to “insurance for a coverage on per occurrence and aggregate basis” and in clause 17.4, “one time of total fees” shall stand replaced by “three times of general capping agreed in clause 17.2.

Can you please confirm the language related to insurance policy? (Insurance clause is clause 19 of the MSA attached). 

They have mentioned these amendments are required to ensure the agreement complies with their insurance policy.

Appreciate your support and let me know if you need further info.

Best,
Faraz

Can you please confirm the language related to insurance policy? (Insurance clause is clause 19 of the MSA attached). 

They have mentioned these amendments are required to ensure the agreement complies with their insurance policy.

Appreciate your support and let me know if you need further info.

Best,
Faraz

Hi Faraz,

 

Sorry for the delay.

 

The below changes requested by Infosys are fine and can be accepted.

 

All references to insurance policies in the MSA “insurance for a minimum of” or any similar expression, shall be deemed amended to “insurance for a coverage on per occurrence and aggregate basis” and in clause 17.4, “one time of total fees” shall stand replaced by “three times of general capping agreed in clause 17.2.

 

Remain at your disposal for any further assistance required.

 

Best Regards,
Hagop
